subject: Cruelty to Animals
lead_paragraph: Tripp Isenhour, a PGA Tour player, was charged with killing a hawk on purpose with a golf shot because it was making noise as he videotaped a television show. Isenhour was with a film crew for “Shoot Like a Pro” on Dec. 12 at the Grand Cypress Golf course in Orlando, Fla. Isenhour, 39, whose real name is John Henry Isenhour III, was charged Wednesday with cruelty to animals and killing a migratory bird. The charges carry a maximum 14 months in jail and $1,500 in fines. Isenhour apologized in a statement and said he was only trying to scare away the hawk.
